item.title: Automakers are starting to admit that drivers hate touchscreens
item.description: - Automakers are starting to acknowledge that many drivers prefer buttons and knobs over touchscreens on their vehicles' dashboards.

item.title: Netflix loses 1M users in Spain over password policing
item.description: - No meaningful content to summarize as the text only provides an error message and a reference ID for support inquiries.

item.title: UK Blocks Microsoft's $69B Activision Deal
item.description: - UK has blocked Microsoft's proposed $69B deal to acquire Activision Blizzard citing national security reasons.

item.title: Linen.dev: A 500 kb Slack alternative
item.description: - Linen.dev is an open-source Slack/Discord alternative that aims to merge the advantages of a forum with the real-time interaction of chat.

item.title: Lessons by 3blue1brown
item.description: - 3Blue1Brown offers free, animated math lessons covering topics such as calculus, linear algebra, neural networks, and more.

item.title: Why is OAuth still hard in 2023?
item.description: - OAuth protocol has inconsistencies and non-standard behaviors, making implementing an API challenging.

item.title: Why did Google Brain exist?
item.description: - Google Brain recently merged with DeepMind and has been rebranded as Google DeepMind.

item.title: Colorado becomes first to pass 'right to repair' for farmers
item.description: Colorado has become the first state in the United States to pass a "right to repair" bill for farm equipment.

item.title: Google Authenticator cloud sync: Google can see the secrets, even while stored
item.description: - DEFCON.social is a decentralized social network powered by Mastodon, with a focus on technology and society.

item.title: Why do prime numbers make these spirals? (2019)
item.description: - Prime numbers are difficult to understand but play a fundamental role in problem-solving.
